About Me

J. Atreyu Kemp

I'm a cybersecurity professional finishing my B.S. in Cybersecurity at Augusta University (May 2026), with hands-on experience across GRC, vulnerability management, SOC operations, and cloud security.

At Georgia AIM, I lead custom SIEM development and conduct NIST 800-53 assessments across manufacturing, healthcare, education, and government sectors. Previously at SIEGE Cyber Ops, I triaged 100+ security alerts weekly using KQL and Microsoft Sentinel, validating containment for 30+ confirmed incidents.

Outside of work I'm building a multi-server home lab with Wazuh, OPNsense, Proxmox, and a hybrid cloud bridge to Azure — because the best way to learn defense is to build what you're protecting.

Experience

Security Analyst — GRC & Vulnerability Management Jan 2025 – Present
Georgia Artificial Intelligence Manufacturing (AIM) · Augusta, GA
  • Led custom SIEM implementation from scope definition through deployment; documentation improved alert quality and reduced mean time to detect threats.
  • Conducted NIST 800-53 aligned assessments across manufacturing, healthcare, education, and government sectors; identified control gaps and delivered prioritized remediation roadmaps.
  • Performed vulnerability scanning for 50+ systems; delivered executive briefings and facilitated tabletop exercises validating incident response procedures.
Tier 1 SOC Analyst Nov 2024 – Apr 2025
SIEGE Cyber Ops · Augusta, GA
  • Investigated 100+ security alerts weekly in Microsoft Sentinel using KQL queries and log correlation to identify lateral movement, privilege escalation, and data exfiltration attempts (MITRE ATT&CK aligned).
  • Conducted phishing and endpoint investigations using Microsoft Defender, Cisco Secure Endpoint, and VirusTotal; validated containment for 30+ confirmed incidents.
  • Produced detailed escalation packages including attack timelines, IOC analysis, affected asset inventories, and remediation recommendations.
Cybersecurity Intern May 2024 – Aug 2024
Club Car, LLC · Augusta, GA
  • Monitored CrowdStrike Falcon detections across 500+ endpoints; escalated 20+ confirmed incidents with documented IOCs, impact assessments, and recommended containment actions.
  • Executed quarterly vulnerability scans using Tenable, tracked remediation of 150+ findings, and maintained security documentation supporting SOC 2 and internal audit requirements.

Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition

Feb 2026 · Team Member

Secured enterprise-level networks by actively monitoring, analyzing, and defending against real-time cyber threats using firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and vulnerability scanners; responded to live cybersecurity incidents in a high-pressure, multi-day competition, mitigating threats such as unauthorized access, malware infections, and system compromises.

Enterprise Security Home Lab

In Progress

Built multi-server lab with network segmentation, multi-factor authentication, and security monitoring; deployed Wazuh for security monitoring, Checkmk for resource monitoring, Tailscale VPN for private access, OPNsense firewall for defense-in-depth traffic logging, Nextcloud for cloud storage, and Lambda AI for LLM assistance across three servers.

Hybrid Cloud Security Lab

Proxmox → Azure · In Progress

Built and secured an on-premises virtualization environment using Proxmox, implementing VM-level firewall rules with a default-deny inbound policy and least-privilege access controls. Validated secure administrative access (SSH) while blocking unauthorized services. Designed a hybrid cloud migration foundation via Site-to-Site IPsec VPN to Azure, aligning firewall segmentation with enterprise cloud security patterns.

ProxmoxMicrosoft AzureIPsec VPNDefault-Deny PolicyLeast Privilege
